verb.description: Remove (someone) from a place of danger to a safer place.
examples: several families were evacuated from their homes

verb.description: Remove air, water, or other contents from (a container)
examples: when it springs a leak, evacuate the pond

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense clear the contents of): from Latin evacuat- (of the bowels) emptied, from the verb evacuare, from e- (variant of ex-) out of + vacuus empty.
